Returns

areEqual

A simple and quick deep equal objects utility. This is meant to be used solely to deduplicate requests payload and perform comparison on JSON ready objects made of primitives string, number and booleans.

It support nested objects and arrays only.

NB: undefined and null values do not count in the comparison as they are usually meant to be ignored in JSON requestBody payloads.

According to very rudimentary tests this function takes on average between 0.15 ms and 2ms to compare two averaged sizes requet body payloads.

areEqual(a: Comparable, b: Comparable?)
Parameters
a (Comparable)
b (Comparable?)

changeUrlPath

Change URL path, ensures initial and ending slashes and normalise eventual consecutive slashes, it uses history.

changeUrlPath(pathname: string, state: object?, replace: boolean?): string
Parameters
pathname (string)
state (object?)
replace (boolean?) Replace URL instead of pushing it in the history stack. By default it pushes it.
Returns
string: The new cleaned pathname

convertRange

Convert range of a number

e.g. converting number 5 in a scale/range from 0 10 to a scale/range from 50 to 100 would return 75

convertRange(5, [0, 10], [50, 100]);
convertRange(num: number, r1: Array<number>, r2: Array<number>): number
Parameters
num (number)
r1 (Array<number>)
r2 (Array<number>)
Returns
number

CookieAttributes

CookieAttributes

Type: {expires: (number | Date | undefined)?, path: (string | undefined)?, domain: (string | undefined)?, secure: (boolean | undefined)?, sameSite: ("strict" | "Strict" | "lax" | "Lax" | "none" | "None" | undefined)?}

Properties
expires ((number | Date | undefined)?)
path ((string | undefined)?)
domain ((string | undefined)?)
secure ((boolean | undefined)?)
sameSite (("strict" | "Strict" | "lax" | "Lax" | "none" | "None" | undefined)?)
Static Members
â–¸ expires

Define when the cookie will be removed. Value can be a Number which will be interpreted as days from time of creation or a Date instance. If omitted, the cookie becomes a session cookie.

expires

Type: (number | Date | undefined)

â–¸ path

Define the path where the cookie is available. Defaults to '/'

path

Type: (string | undefined)

â–¸ domain

Define the domain where the cookie is available. Defaults to the domain of the page where the cookie was created.

domain

Type: (string | undefined)

â–¸ secure

A Boolean indicating if the cookie transmission requires a secure protocol (https).

secure

Type: (boolean | undefined)

â–¸ sameSite

Asserts that a cookie must not be sent with cross-origin requests, providing some protection against cross-site request forgery attacks (CSRF)

sameSite

Type: ("strict" | "Strict" | "lax" | "Lax" | "none" | "None" | undefined)

An attribute which will be serialized, conformably to RFC 6265 section 5.2.

createPalette

Create palette, this is primarily thought to improve the reuse of a palette definition between TailwindCSS and straight ES imports

createPalette
Parameters
name (TName)
shades (TShades)
Returns
any: An array with: 1) A flat palette map 2) A TailwindCSS ready palette object 3) A flat array of colors (no special sorting, same order as the shades given as argument)

Defer

new Defer()
Related
https://stackoverflow.com/a/37673534/1938970
Example
```ts
const deferred = Defer();
deferred.resolve();
deferred.then(handleSuccess, handleError);
```

Emitter

Emitter super simple class

Events will be prefixed with the given namespace plus a . so: {namespace}.myevent

Adapted from https://github.com/developit/mitt

Regarding typescript support @see:

  • https://stackoverflow.com/q/53299743/1938970
  • https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/pull/26349
new Emitter(namespace: string)
Parameters
namespace (string)

min

It behaves the same as (min-width: ${value}px) where value is the given breakpoint value. For ease of use this can be used both as a function min("md") and as an object literal min.md.

min
Parameters
br (Breakpoint)

max

It behaves the same as (max-width: ${value}px) where value is the given breakpoint value. For ease of use this can be used both as a function max("md") and as an object literal max.md.

max
Parameters
br (Breakpoint)

up

It behaves the same as min

up

down

It behaves similarly to max but you will use the "next" breakpoint, specifying CSS that will apply from the given breakpoint and down.

down
Parameters
br (Breakpoint)

between

Media query between the two given breakpoints

between
Parameters
br1 (Breakpoint)
br2 (Breakpoint?)

only

Media query to apply from the given breakpoint until the next, just for its full range

only
Parameters
br (Breakpoint)

getParamAmong

Get query parameter as string treating the ParsedUrlQuery result of querystring (used in next.js router and elsewhere)

getParamAmong(raw: string?, allowedValues: Array<string>)
Parameters
raw (string?) The raw query parameter
allowedValues (Array<string> = []) The list of values (as strings) that the parameter can have, if not one of them null is returned

getParamAsInt

Get query parameter as integer treating the ParsedUrlQuery result of querystring (used in next.js router and elsewhere)

getParamAsInt(raw: string?, fallback: number?)
Parameters
raw (string?) The raw query parameter
fallback (number? = null as TFallback) Fallback number, we return null if not provided

Get query parameter as string treating the ParsedUrlQuery result of querystring (used in next.js router and elsewhere)

getParamAsString(raw: string?)
Parameters
raw (string?) The raw query parameter

getUrlHashParams

It returns the "query params" as an object extracting it from the given hash string or, if not provided, failling back reading the location.hash

getUrlHashParams(hash: any)
Parameters
hash (any = "")

getUrlHashPathname

It returns the "pathname" cleaned up from the # and the initial slashes extracting it from the given hash string or, if not provided, failling back reading the location.hash

getUrlHashPathname(hash: any)
Parameters
hash (any = "")

getUrlPathnameParts

Get pathname parts

First clean the pathname from the first slash if any then split the pathname in parts, Given a pathname like: "/en/{prefix}/{collection}/{slug}" we obtain [locale, prefix, collection, slug]

getUrlPathnameParts(pathname: any)
Parameters
pathname (any = "")

getUrlQueryParams

Get parsed query parameters as object dictionary (from URL or given query string)

getUrlQueryParams(url: string?)
Parameters
url (string?) A URL which contains a ? , e.g. ?myparam=x or https://a.com?myparams=x . If not provided it defaults reading the current URL query string with location.search . Through this argument you can use this same function to parse, for instance, the query params of the href of a <a href="..."> HTML tag.

imgEmptyPixel

Empty img pixel as a string to inline

imgEmptyPixel

Type: string

invariant

FIXME: invariant calls do not get tree shaked in minified output of projects using it. Let's not use it internally and not export it from @olmokit/utils until we find a tree-shakeable way of doing this. For now just wrapping the logging code into if (process.env["NODE_ENV"] !== "production") {} works better despite it is more verbose.

invariant(condition: any, message: (string | function (): string)?, lib: string?, prefix: string?): any
Parameters
condition (any) The condition that, if true will throw the error during development
message ((string | function (): string)?) A string or a function that returns a string
lib (string?) The library name to show in the error message prefix. When lib is also specified it outputs [lib:prefix]: the message , otherwise just [lib|prefix]: the message )
prefix (string?) The library name to show in the error message prefix. When lib is also specified it outputs [lib:prefix]: the message , otherwise just [lib|prefix]: the message )
Returns
any

isType

Does a generic check to check that the given payload is of a given type. In cases like Number, it will return true for NaN as NaN is a Number (thanks javascript!); It will, however, differentiate between object and null

isType(payload: any, type: T): any
Parameters
payload (any)
type (T)
Returns
any
Throws
  • TypeError: Will throw type error if type is an invalid type

match-sorter

Slightly adapted from Kent C. Dodd's match-sorter differences are:

  • less exports
  • smaller output
  • no external deps

TODO: turn objects into arrays for smaller output?

match-sorter
License: MIT license.
Author: Kent C. Dodds <me@kentcdodds.com> (https://kentcdodds.com)
Copyright: (c) 2020 Kent C. Dodds

matchSorter

Takes an array of items and a value and returns a new array with the items that match the given value

matchSorter(items: Array, value: String, options: Object): Array
Parameters
items (Array) the items to sort
value (String) the value to use for ranking
options (Object = {}) Some options to configure the sorter
Returns
Array: the new sorted array

getHighestRanking

Gets the highest ranking for value for the given item based on its values for the given keys

getHighestRanking(item: any, keys: Array, value: String, options: Object): {rank: Number, keyIndex: Number, keyThreshold: Number}
Parameters
item (any) the item to rank
keys (Array) the keys to get values from the item for the ranking
value (String) the value to rank against
options (Object) options to control the ranking
Returns
{rank: Number, keyIndex: Number, keyThreshold: Number}: the highest ranking

getMatchRanking

Gives a rankings score based on how well the two strings match.

getMatchRanking(testString: String, stringToRank: String, options: Object): Number
Parameters
testString (String) the string to test against
stringToRank (String) the string to rank
options (Object) options for the match (like keepDiacritics for comparison)
Returns
Number: the ranking for how well stringToRank matches testString

getAcronym

Generates an acronym for a string.

getAcronym(string: String): String
Parameters
string (String) the string for which to produce the acronym
Returns
String: the acronym

getClosenessRanking

Returns a score based on how spread apart the characters from the stringToRank are within the testString. A number close to RANKING_MATCHES represents a loose match. A number close to RANKING_MATCHES + 1 represents a tighter match.

getClosenessRanking(testString: String, stringToRank: String): Number
Parameters
testString (String) the string to test against
stringToRank (String) the string to rank
Returns
Number: the number between RANKING_MATCHES and RANKING_MATCHES + 1 for how well stringToRank matches testString

sortRankedValues

Sorts items that have a rank, index, and keyIndex

sortRankedValues(a: Object, b: Object, baseSort: BaseSorter<ItemType>): Number
Parameters
a (Object) the first item to sort
b (Object) the second item to sort
baseSort (BaseSorter<ItemType>)
Returns
Number: -1 if a should come first, 1 if b should come first, 0 if equal

prepareValueForComparison

Prepares value for comparison by stringifying it, removing diacritics (if specified)

prepareValueForComparison(value: String, options: Object): String
Parameters
value (String) the value to clean
options (Object) {keepDiacritics: whether to remove diacritics}
Name Description
options.keepDiacritics any
Returns
String: the prepared value

getItemValues

Gets value for key in item at arbitrarily nested keypath

getItemValues(item: Object, key: (Object | Function)): Array
Parameters
item (Object) the item
key ((Object | Function)) the potentially nested keypath or property callback
Returns
Array: an array containing the value(s) at the nested keypath

getNestedValues

Given path: "foo.bar.baz" And item: {foo: {bar: {baz: 'buzz'}}} -> 'buzz'

getNestedValues(path: string, item: ItemType): Array<string>
Parameters
path (string) a dot-separated set of keys
item (ItemType) the item to get the value from
Returns
Array<string>

getAllValuesToRank

Gets all the values for the given keys in the given item and returns an array of those values

getAllValuesToRank(item: ItemType, keys: ReadonlyArray<KeyOption<ItemType>>): any
Parameters
item (ItemType) the item from which the values will be retrieved
keys (ReadonlyArray<KeyOption<ItemType>>) the keys to use to retrieve the values
Returns
any: objects with {itemValue, attributes}

getKeyAttributes

Gets all the attributes for the given key

getKeyAttributes(key: KeyOption<ItemType>): KeyAttributes
Parameters
key (KeyOption<ItemType>) the key from which the attributes will be retrieved
Returns

mbToBytes

RenderFunction

Returned render function

RenderFunction

Type: function (data: object): string

RenderTemplate

Default render function creator

RenderTemplate

Type: function (template: string): RenderFunction

render

Render template (adapted from doT.js)

The data made available to the template is always on the data key, e.g.: renderer({ myVal: "xx" }) ... will be accessible on <%= data.myVal %>

The default delimiters are customised to work without conflicts with Blade and Twig:

<% %>	for evaluation
<%= %>	for interpolation
<%? %>	for conditionals
<%~ %>	for array iteration
<%# %>	for compile-time evaluation/includes and partials
<%## #%>	for compile-time defines

Unsupported:
<%! %>	for interpolation with encoding
render
Parameters
tmpl (string)
def (Definitions?)
Returns
RenderFunction
Related
https://olado.github.io/doT/index.html
Example
```js
import { render } from "...";

const data = { name: "XYZ" };
const tpl = `Hello <%= data.name %>`;
const renderer = render(tpl);

console.log(renderer(data)); // outputs 'Hello XYZ'
```

roundTo

roundTo(num: number, decimals: any): string

string

fieldContentRegExp

RegExp to match field-content in RFC 7230 sec 3.2

field-content = field-vchar [ 1*( SP / HTAB ) field-vchar ] field-vchar = VCHAR / obs-text obs-text = %x80-FF

fieldContentRegExp

serializeCookie

Serialize data into a cookie header.

Serialize the a name value pair into a cookie string suitable for http headers. An optional attributes object specified cookie parameters.

serialize('foo', 'bar', { httpOnly: true }) => "foo=bar; httpOnly"

serializeCookie(name: string, val: string, attributes: CookieAttributesServer)

name (string)

attributes (CookieAttributesServer = {})

PickStartsWith

Pick the keys of an object T that starts with S. It produces a mapped type with a subset of T whose keys start with S.

KeysStartsWith

Returns a union of all the keys of an object T which starts with S.
